title: Chris Hughes talks moving in, marriage and babies with Jesy Nelson
text:
To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

Chris Hughes and Jesy Nelson may be serious couple goals, but they’re not planning to rush into marriage or babies anytime soon – because they need to get a place first.

The former Love Island star told Metro.co.uk on the Pride Of Britain Awards red carpet that the pair are just enjoying life as a couple at the moment, though it could be on the cards in the future.

Chris revealed: ‘We’ve got to get a house first! That would be the first step, then we’ll just see what happens from there.

Advertisement

‘We haven’t planned anything yet so we’re just enjoying life at the minute and seeing where it goes.’

Chris also gushed about how proud he was about Jesy opening up about her struggles with trolling in her recent documentary, Jesy Nelson: Odd One Out.

In it, the Little Mix star revealed the abuse she received from trolls on social media got so bad that she considered suicide.

Chris agrees that her speaking out on the subject has helped others know they are not alone, as well as opening up a conversation in all age groups.

Get you a man who looks at you the way Chris Hughes looks at Jesy Nelson (Picture: Instagram)

He explained: ‘It was unbelievable, so proud. She’s just such a strong girl and it will help thousands and thousands of people, whether it’s children growing up, kids in school, whatever it is.

‘It will help adults as well to learn what the internet is actually about when they might have been quite naïve to it.’

He added that he and Jesy are each other’s natural support system, after he opened up about struggling with his appetite recently.

Chris said: ‘We just support each other in day to day life, it just comes naturally to us. When you really care for someone, you have respect for them, you don’t have to think about supporting them, it just comes, it’s all natural.’
